issue.title: Bug pylint 4019

repository.name: pylint
repository.description: It's not just a linter that annoys you!

issue.body:
## Steps

- [x] Add a ChangeLog entry describing what your PR does.
- [x] Write a good description on what the PR does.

## Description
During detection of `inconsistent-return-statements`, consider that an `assert False` statement is equivalent to a return node.

## Type of Changes
<!-- Leave the corresponding lines for the applicable type of change: -->
|   | Type |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| ✓  | :bug: Bug fix  |

## Related Issue
Closes #4019

body: By "insecable space" do you mean the non-breaking space (nbsp) character https://www.compart.com/en/unicode/U+00A0 ? If so it seems reasonable to me for Black to replace leading nbsps in comments.
Yes, sorry if it was not clear I translated the name from french.

rename.from: Remove insecable spaces at the beggining of comments
rename.to: Remove non-breaking space at the beggining of comments

body: I'm interested to work on this, if a pull request with this change is going to be merged.
I'd merge it (unless someone else comes up with a problem with this suggestion).

issue.title: Remove NBSP at the beggining of comments
issue.body:
This is a fast attempt to do #2091. I suppose we could remove the while and put a simple ``if`` to not remove multiple consecutive NBSP.

Closes #2091

body: I made an attempt, but I have a [crash with type ignore comment for python 3.6 and 3.7](https://github.com/psf/black/pull/2092/checks?check_run_id=2290658688) and I don't quite know what to do with it. Do you have an advise on how to debug it ?
